content.question: A local school board wanted to investigate whether their approval ratings had changed during the past year. The board selected random samples of voters at both the beginning and the end of the year, and each time the voters were asked whether they approve of the school board. Let <math alttext="p sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> represent the proportion of voters who approved of the school board at the beginning of the year and <math alttext="p sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> represent the proportion of voters who approved of the school board at the end of the year. Which of the following are the correct null and alternative hypotheses for the school board’s investigation?

choices.label: <math alttext="H sub 0: p sub 1 equals p sub 2. H sub a: p sub 1 is not equal to p sub 2." display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnalign="left"><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>≠</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="H sub 0: p sub 1 is not equal to p sub 2. H sub a: p sub 1 equals p sub 2." display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnalign="left"><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>≠</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="H sub 0: p sub 1 equals p sub 2. H sub a: p sub 1 is less than p sub 2." display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnalign="left"><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>0</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="H sub 0: p sub 1 equals p sub 2. H sub a: p sub 1 is greater than p sub 2." display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnalign="left"><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>0</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="H sub 0: p sub 1 is greater than p sub 2. H sub a: p sub 1 equals p sub 2." display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnalign="left"><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="H sub 0: p sub 1 equals p sub 2. H sub a: p sub 1 is not equal to p sub 2." display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnalign="left"><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>≠</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 6.10: Setting Up a Test for the Difference of Two Population Proportions

skill.text: Skill 1.F: Identify null and alternative hypotheses.
